page.title: List of commercial video games released as freeware

revisions.rev:
{{Refimprove|date=May 2011}}
Commercial video games released as freeware are games that, in their original license, were not considered [[freeware]], but were re-released at a later date with a freeware license, sometimes as publicity for a forthcoming sequel or compilation release.
Some of the following games are not [[freely redistributable software]], as they have only been made available as a free download as freeware, but may only be downloaded from certain websites and with the explicit permission of the copyright owner. Consult the [[software license agreement]].
For games that were originally released as freeware, see [[List of freeware video games]]. For [[FLOSS]] games, and proprietary games re-released as FLOSS, see [[List of open source video games]].
==Available games== The following formerly paid games have been made available as freeware, and are still in that status: {{compactTOC4}} <!--READ BEFORE ADDING A GAME TO THE TABLE: This is not an exhaustive directory. Games listed here need to show how they are notable. Free Christmas Edition) in 2005. |- | ''[[Titans of Steel|Titans of Steel: Warring Suns]]'' |2003 | | | | | a [[Battletech]]-style [[turn based strategy]] game released free on February 14, 2008. |- | ''[[Total Extreme Wrestling 2005]]'' |2005 | | | |Greydog Software. | [[booking simulator]] computer game by Released for free on July 1, 2009. |- | ''[[Treasure Island Dizzy]]'' |1987 | | | | | a [[Puzzle video game|puzzle]] game by the [[Oliver twins]]. |- | ''[[Tribes 2]]'' |2001 | | |Windows and Linux |[[Dynamix]]/[[Sierra On-Line]], | a [[first-person shooter]] by free download release in 2004 as publicity for the release of [[Tribes: Vengeance]]. |- | ''[[Trivia Whiz]]'' |1988 | | | |[[3D Realms|Apogee Software]]. | a trivia game by |- | ''[[Turboraketti II]]'' |1993 | | | |Heikki Kosola. | an Amiga cavern-flying game by |- | ''[[Universal Combat]]'' |2004 | | | |by [[Derek Smart]], | a [[space simulator]] released as freeware on January 2, 2008. |- | ''[[Vantage Master|Vantage Master Online]]'' |1998 | | | |by [[Nihon Falcom]], | a [[tactical RPG]] released as freeware in 2002. |- | ''[[Warzone 2100]]'' |1999 | | |Windows, Mac OS X, Linux, FreeBSD, AmigaOS 4, PlayStation | by Pumpkin Studios, |released as freeware in 2004 and free software in 2008. |- | ''[[Wild Metal Country]]'' |1999 | | | | by [[Rockstar Games]], |released as [[registerware]] freeware in 2004. |- | ''[[Wings (computer game)|Wings]]'' |1990 | | | |[[Cinemaware]]. |a flying game by |- | ''[[Wings (1996 video game)|Wings]]'' |1996 | | | |Miika Virpioja. | a cavern-flying game by |- | ''[[Zero Tolerance (game)|Zero Tolerance]]'' |1994 | | | |by [[Technopop (developer)|Technopop]]. | a [[Sega Mega Drive|Sega Mega Drive/Genesis]] first person shooter game | |- |''[[Operation Carnage]]'' |1996 | |[[Shoot 'em up]] |[[DOS]] |Beaucomm Interactive |Released as freeware by the developers, Midnight Synergy<ref>http://www.midnightsynergy.com/ancient.htm</ref> |}
==Games no longer distributed== The following are commercial games that were re-released as freeware but were not [[freely redistributable software]]. They were only available as freeware for a limited time, but could not be redistributed, so they are no longer freely available.
* ''[[Airborne Ranger]]'' (1988), a stealth 2D game by [[Microprose]]. It was released as freeware by Atari to promote Airborne Rangers. A free registration was required to download the game. After Airborne Rangers wasn't released, the [[Airborne Ranger]] page and the download link were removed. The game is still mentioned as freeware and many forums and sites have the now dead link to the game page. The legal situation now is unclear because the installer has no disclaimer. * ''[[Area 51 (2005 video game)|Area 51]]'' (2005), a first person shooter by [[Midway Games]]. Its free release was sponsored by the [[US Air Force]]. It later changed hands and its freeware status was removed.<ref>[http://www.gamershell.com/download_33790.shtml Area 51 Free Full Game]</ref> * ''[[B-17 Flying Fortress (computer game)|B-17 Flying Fortress]]'' (1992), a [[Flight simulator#Flight Simulators at Home|flight simulator]] by [[MicroProse]].<ref name="LiberatedGames">[http://www.liberatedgames.com/forums/index.php?t=msg&rid=3&th=48&goto=227 General Liberated Games FAQ]</ref> * ''[[Betrayal at Krondor]]'' (1993), a [[role-playing game]] by [[Dynamix]].<ref name="LiberatedGames" /> * ''[[Caesar (video game)|Caesar]]'' (1993), a city-building game by Sierra.<ref name="LiberatedGames" /> * ''[[Far Cry]]'' (2004), first-person shooter computer game developed by [[Crytek]]. Ubisoft had released the game in a four-day promotion as ad-supported freeware on FilePlanet. * ''[[Gateway (computer game)|Gateway]]'' (1992), an adventure game by [[Legend Entertainment]]. * ''[[Portal (video game)|Portal]]'' (2007), an action/puzzle game by [[Valve Corporation]], available from May 12, 2010, for two weeks to promote the Steam client's availability to Mac users. * ''[[Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time]]'' (2003), third-person action adventure video game developed by [[Ubisoft Montreal]]. Ubisoft released the game as ad-supported freeware on FilePlanet for a limited time.<ref>[http://www.gamershell.com/download_20868.shtml Full Games: Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time Free Full Game (Ad Supported) - Demo Movie Patch Download Section - GamersHell.com<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> * ''[[Rayman Raving Rabbids]]'' (2006), a video game in the popular [[Rayman]] series, developed by [[Ubisoft Montpellier]]. Ubisoft had released the PC version of the game in a four-day promotion as ad-supported freeware on FilePlanet. * ''[[Red Baron 3D]]'' (1998), a flight game by Sierra.<ref name="LiberatedGames" /> * ''[[Rise and Fall: Civilizations at War]]'' (2006), a [[real-time strategy]]/[[third-person shooter]] by [[Stainless Steel Studios]] and [[Midway Games]]. Re-released as ad-supported freeware, sponsored by the [[US Air Force]].<ref>[http://www.gamershell.com/download_33916.shtml Rise & Fall: Civilizations At War Free Full Game]</ref> * ''[[Runaway: A Road Adventure|Runaway]]'' (1997), an adventure game by [[Pendulo Studios]] and published for [[Dinamic Multimedia]] and more later by [[FX Interactive]]. The game was released for free for 30 days to celebrate the launch of ''[[Hollywood Monsters 2]]'', a.k.a. ''[[The Next Big Thing (video game)|The Next BIG Thing]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fxinteractive.com/noticias/ghm2-sp.html|title=Hollywood Monsters 2 ya estÃ¡ en las tiendas de toda EspaÃ±a|publisher=[[FX Interactive]]|language=spanish}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fxinteractive.com/noticias/chm2-ita.html|title=Lunga vita allâavventura! Hollywood Monsters 2 Ã¨ giÃ qui|publisher=[[FX Interactive]]|language=italian}}</ref> * ''[[The Suffering (video game)|The Suffering]]'' (2004), a horror third/first person shooter developed by [[Surreal Software]] and published by [[Midway Games]]. It was released free in September 2008, but is no longer available due to a new copyright holder.<ref>[http://www.gamershell.com/download_33314.shtml The Suffering Free Full Game]</ref> * ''[[Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon]]'' (2001), a [[tactical shooter]] by [[Ubisoft]]. Released in an ad-supported free download version in 2007 for a limited time; available to US residents only.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.gamershell.com/download_20866.shtml |title=Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon Free Full Game (Ad Supported) |accessdate=18 March 2009 |quote=You will need an Ubi.com account and you must live in the U.S. to play the game |publisher=[[GamersHell.com]]}}</ref> * ''[[Zork I]]'', ''[[Zork II]]'', ''[[Zork III]]'', and ''[[Zork: The Undiscovered Underground]]'', text adventure games by [[Infocom]].<ref name="LiberatedGames" />
